title: Shapes and Syllables Escape
intro: You are in a quiet study with three small safes, each marked with a different shape, and a single locked door. Everything you need to escape is already visible in the room.

objects.name: safe with a star
objects.inspect_text: A small metal safe with a glowing star symbol on the front and a three-digit keypad.

lock.on_success_text: The star safe clicks open. Inside is a card that reads: "One third of the final password is 'art'."
lock.on_failure_text: The star safe buzzes angrily. That code doesn’t work.

objects.name: safe with a circle
objects.inspect_text: A sturdy safe with a circle symbol etched above a four-digit keypad.

lock.on_success_text: The circle safe opens. Inside you find a note: "One third of the final password is 'ific'."
lock.on_failure_text: Nothing happens. The circle safe rejects that code.

objects.name: safe with a square
objects.inspect_text: A compact safe with a small square symbol and a four-digit keypad below it.

lock.on_success_text: The square safe unlocks. Inside is a slip of paper: "One third of the final password is 'ial'."
lock.on_failure_text: The keypad blinks red on the square safe. Wrong code.

objects.name: painting of a starry night
objects.inspect_text: It’s a painting reminiscent of a starry night sky. On the back, someone has written: "For the star, remember: 1-2-3."

objects.name: round wall clock
objects.inspect_text: A circular wall clock is frozen at 12:35. Underneath, in small print: "Circle keeps time."

objects.name: square window with four panels
objects.inspect_text: A square window divided into four glass panels. Etched faintly on the panes from left to right are the digits: 0, 1, 2, 3.

objects.name: note on the bulletin board
objects.inspect_text: Pinned to the board: "Shapes speak to their own. Match each shape to its twin object to learn its code."

objects.name: folded instruction sheet
objects.inspect_text: A folded sheet on a side table reads: "When you know all three parts, read them in this order: star, circle, square."

objects.name: heavy wooden door
objects.inspect_text: A solid wooden door bars your exit. Instead of numbers, its keypad expects a single word as the password.

lock.on_success_text: The lock chimes softly and the wooden door swings open. You have successfully escaped.
lock.on_failure_text: The lock gives a dull click, then resets. That is not the correct word.

objects.name: tall bookshelf
objects.inspect_text: The shelf holds books titled "Star Charts", "Circular Reasoning", and "Square One". Their contents are just stories; they reinforce the shapes but give no extra numbers.

objects.name: writing desk
objects.inspect_text: On the desk, a scribble says: "Open all three shape safes. Only then will the final word make sense."

objects.name: desk lamp
objects.inspect_text: A small lamp throws a triangular patch of light onto the wall. There are no numbers or words hidden in the light.

objects.name: geometric rug
objects.inspect_text: The rug shows repeating patterns of stars, circles, and squares. It seems to echo the theme of the room but doesn’t reveal any codes.

objects.name: potted plant
objects.inspect_text: Under the pot is a card: "Three pieces, one word. Don’t assume the parts arrive in order."
